Model objects are used for data, they have nothing to do with UI
Controller retrieves data requested by the Views
View objects are related to the UI layer
View objects are coded in HTML and jetpack compose
View objects send signals to the model
Controllers deal with data: retrieve, update, delete
Controller updates views with changes from model layer
MVC architecture is good for both small and large projects
An activity is responsible for managing user interaction with a screen
ConstraintLayouts, Buttons and TextViews are Controller examples
Nonexistent activities are the "destroyed state," they cannot be interacted with and do not exist in memory
Stopped exists in memory and occurs when you close the app
Paused state occurs when an activity is in memory and partially visible but not in foreground, like during multi-window mode
Only one activity can be in the resumed state at a time, it is in memory, visible and in the foreground
We call onCreate to control app state
